Welcome to REST API App’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.add_process_time_header(request: Request, call_next)¶

The add_process_time_header function adds a ‘My-Process-Time’ header to the response with the time taken to process the request.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the incoming request object

  • call_next – Call the next middleware or route handler

Returns:

The response object with the added ‘my-process-time’ header

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is used to check the health of the API by executing a query on the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message indicating the health status of the api

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function is a simple function that returns the message &quot;Hello, world!&quot; in a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary, so the return_type is dict

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It can be used to perform tasks that are needed before the application can serve requests, such as initializing a database connection or setting up caches.

Returns:

A coroutine, which is async

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id of the contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Type[Contact] | None¶

The get_contact function retrieves a contact from the database based on the provided contact ID, user, and database session.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to retrieve

  • user – User: Ensure that the contact is associated with the user

  • db – Session: Execute the query

Returns:

A contact object or none

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function retrieves contacts based on the provided skip, limit, user, and database session parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Indicate the number of records to skip

  • limit – int: Limit the number of records that are returned

  • user – User: Specify the user whose contacts are being retrieved

  • db – Session: Create a database session object

Returns:

A list of contact objects that match the criteria specified

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthday(user: User, db: Session) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

The get_contacts_birthday function retrieves a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days for a given user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user for whom to retrieve contacts

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects whose birthday is within the next 7 days

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_email(email_part: str, user: User, db: Session) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

The get_contacts_email function retrieves contacts with emails containing a specific part, belonging to a user.

Parameters:

  • email_part – str: Specify the part of the email to search for

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

A list of contact objects that match the search criteria

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_first_name(first_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

The get_contacts_first_name function retrieves contacts by first name for a specific user from the database.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Specify the first name to search for in contacts

  • user – User: Retrieve contacts for a specific user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session object to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_last_name(last_name: str, user: User, db: Session) → list[Type[Contact]]¶

The get_contacts_last_name function asynchronously retrieves a list of contacts with a specific last name for the given user.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Specify the last name to search for

  • user – User: Pass in the user object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects which have the specified last name

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session object to the function

Returns:

The removed contact object if it exists, otherwise none

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to update

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass in the new information for the contact

  • user – User: Ensure that the user performing the update is authorized to do so

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

The updated contact object or none if the contact was not found

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user using the provided UserModel instance and database session.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass the usermodel instance containing user information

  • db – Session: Specify the database session to use for adding the new user

Returns:

A user instance

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → Type[User] | None¶

The get_user_by_email function retrieves a user from the database based on the provided email.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session object

Returns:

A user object or none

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → Type[User] | None¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user object or none if the user is not found

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • token – str | None: Pass the new refresh token to be assigned to the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact data to be created

  • db – Session: Pass the database session dependency

  • current_user – User: Get the currently authenticated user

Returns:

A contactresponse

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthdays function retrieves the birthdays of contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Retrieve the current user

Returns:

A list of contact responses

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function retrieves a contact from the database by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Ensure that the user making the request is authorized to do so

Returns:

A contactresponse object

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function retrieves a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Determine how many records to skip

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • current_user – User: Get the currently authenticated user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_email(email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_email function retrieves contacts by email address.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the contact

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current authenticated user

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects representing the contacts with the specified email

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_first_name(first_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_first_name function retrieves contacts from the database based on the provided first name. It uses the get_contacts_first_name method from the repository_contacts module to perform the database query. If no contacts are found, it raises an HTTPException with a status code of 404 and a detail message of &quot;Contact not found&quot;.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Specify the first name of the contacts to search for

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the given first name

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_last_name(last_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_last_name function is used to get contacts by last name.

Parameters:

  • last_name – str: Get contacts by last name

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given last name

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contactresponse

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact with the given contact_id using the provided ContactUpdate body.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass the updated contact information to the function

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current authenticated user

Returns:

A contactresponse object

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function reads the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user’s information

Returns:

The current user’s information from the database

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

It takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file containing the avatar image. It also takes in a User object, which represents the currently authenticated user. Finally it takes in a Session object, which represents our database session dependency.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to the server

  • current_user – User: Get the currently authenticated user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object with the new avatar

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is an endpoint for confirming the user’s email address using the provided token. It retrieves the email from the token, checks if the user exists, and if the email is already confirmed. If it finds that a user with that email does not exist or has already been confirmed, it raises an HTTPException with a status code of 400 and an error detail message.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Retrieve the email from the token

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A success message if the user’s email is already confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function authenticates a user and returns access and refresh tokens.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A tokenmodel object

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token using the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A dictionary of the access token, refresh token and bearer

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to request an email for confirming a user’s account.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Pass in the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Run background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary containing a message indicating the status of the email request

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user account.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data to be created

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Execute the send_email function asynchronously

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates an access token based on the provided data and expiration time.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the data that is to be encoded into the access token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function decodes a refresh token and returns the email associated with it.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to be decoded

Returns:

The email associated with the refresh token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used to retrieve the current user. It uses the OAuth2PasswordBearer scheme to validate and decode JWT tokens. If credentials are invalid or if no user with such email exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The current user based on the provided token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password string and returns the hashed version of that password. The hashing algorithm used is determined by the CryptContext object passed to FastAPI when creating an instance of the Security class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function is used to verify a plain text password against a hashed password. The function returns True if the plain text password matches the hashed one, and False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Verify the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password to the plain_password parameter

Returns:

True or false depending on whether the password matches

src.services.auth.create_email_token(self, data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function creates a JWT token using the provided data dictionary. The function takes in a self parameter, which is an instance of the class, and a data parameter, which is a dictionary containing the data to encode. The function then copies this data into another dictionary called to_encode and adds two additional keys: iat (issued at) and exp (expiration). The iat key contains the current time in UTC format while exp contains 7 days from now in UTC format. Finally, we use jwt’s encode method to create our token with our secret key.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in a dictionary containing the data to encode

Returns:

A jwt token encoded with the provided data and secret key

async src.services.auth.get_email_from_token(self, token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token string as input and attempts to decode it using the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM. If successful, it extracts the email from the decoded payload and returns it. If an exception of type JWTError is caught, it prints the error and raises an HTTPException with status code 422 and detail &quot;Invalid token for email verification&quot;.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token string

Returns:

The email string

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function is used to send an email asynchronously with the given email, username, and host.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address to send the email to

  • username – str: Send the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass in the host for the email

Returns:

None
